steps.title: Measure Coca-Cola into a punch bowl.
steps.content: Measure Coca-Cola into a punch bowl. Pour a 16-ounce (473 ml) bottle of Coca-Cola into a punch bowl or serving pitcher. If you don't have Coca-Cola, substitute any cola flavored soft drink.Use chilled Coca-Cola to keep the drinks cold. [1] X Research source You can easily double or triple this recipe as long as you keep the proportions the same. Just use a larger punch bowl.

steps.title: Add the Mountain Dew to the bowl.
steps.content: Add the Mountain Dew to the bowl. Open a 16-ounce (473 ml) bottle of Mountain Dew, Mello Yello, or Sprite and pour it into the Coca-Cola in the punch bowl. Pour slowly to prevent the soda from fizzing up a lot.

steps.title: Pour in cream soda and stir the Nuka Cola.
steps.content: Pour in cream soda and stir the Nuka Cola. Open and pour in a 16-ounce (473 ml) bottle of cream soda. Take a long spoon and slowly stir the mixture until the liquids are combined.

steps.title: Serve the Nuka Cola.
steps.content: Serve the Nuka Cola. Set out serving glasses so guests can help themselves to this fizzy drink. If you'd like to put the cola in bottles, use a funnel to pour it into the bottles and serve them before the Nuka cola loses its carbonation. If you choose to bottle the Nuka cola, consider setting out some old Nuka Cola Caps.

steps.title: Chill the liquids.
steps.content: Chill the liquids. Place 1 16-ounce (473 ml) can of Monster “Ultra Blue” energy drink, a bottle of Gatorade "Icy Charge," and a bottle of Mountain Dew "Voltage" into a refrigerator. Chill the liquids for at least a few hours, so they're completely cold. [2] X Research source You can substitute other energy drinks or sodas as long as they're blue.

steps.title: Measure the ingredients into your serving pitcher.
steps.content: Measure the ingredients into your serving pitcher. Open the can of Monster energy drink and pour it into a serving pitcher or punch bowl. Pour 1 cup (240 ml) of the Gatorade and 2 cups (240 ml) of the Mountain Dew into the pitcher. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Stir and serve the Nuka Cola Quantum.
steps.content: Stir and serve the Nuka Cola Quantum. Use a long handled spoon to stir the liquids together gently. Set out serving glasses or use a funnel to transfer the drinks to glass bottles. Since Nuka Cola Quantum doesn't have as much carbonation, you'll need to serve it right away before it loses its fizz. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Mix cherry Nuka Cola.
steps.content: Mix cherry Nuka Cola. For the popular variation on Nuka Cola, combine equal parts of cherry Coca-Cola with equal parts of Monster "Ultra Black" energy drink. For example, pour 2 cans of cola with 2 cans of energy drink and stir until they're combined. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Create Nuka Cola victory.
steps.content: Create Nuka Cola victory. To make the bright orange Nuka Cola, mix 5 parts of orange soda with 3 parts of orange Gatorade and 2 parts of Monster "Ultra Sunrise." Serve the victory cola while it's still fizzy. [6] X Research source To make 10 servings, use 5 cups (1.2 liters) of orange soda, 3 cups (709 ml) of orange Gatorade, and 2 cups (473 ml) of the orange energy drink. If you keep the proportions the same, you can double or triple the recipe.

steps.title: Make Nuka Cola dark.
steps.content: Make Nuka Cola dark. If you'd like to make a rich, alcoholic version of Nuka Cola dark, measure 10 parts of Coca-Cola into a punch bowl. Pour in 4 parts of fruity cognac (such as Hennessy Black), 2 parts of raspberry syrup, and 1 part of caramel syrup. [7] X Research source To make the drink a little less sweet, you could substitute iced raspberry tea for the raspberry syrup.
